item.title: The First Minute
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Netflix gives an answer to the question “You login to a Linux server with a performance issue: what do you check in the first minute?” in Linux Performance Analysis in 60,000 Milliseconds. The short version: uptime dmesg | tail vmstat 1 mpstat -P ALL 1 pidstat 1 iostat -xz 1 free -m sar -n DEV […]
item.content:encoded:
Netflix gives an answer to the question “You login to a Linux server with a performance issue: what do you check in the first minute?” in Linux Performance Analysis in 60,000 Milliseconds.

The short version:

uptime
dmesg | tail
vmstat 1
mpstat -P ALL 1
pidstat 1
iostat -xz 1
free -m
sar -n DEV 1
sar -n TCP,ETCP 1
top

They provide a short discussion on each tool.

Anything else you would add?

item.title: Netflix & FreeBSD
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: The Netflix Open Connect Appliances installed at ISPs are built on FreeBSD.
item.content:encoded: The Netflix Open Connect Appliances installed at ISPs are built on FreeBSD.

item.title: Netflix Now Showing Gumby SciFi
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: This is the Science Fiction and Fantasy section of my Netflix account: Granted a movie staring talking balls of clay is pretty fantastic, but I don’t think I’d put it in the realm of “SciFi & Fantasy”. Then again, you’ve got Babe in there as well, so perhaps it is my perception of what SciFi […]
item.content:encoded:
This is the Science Fiction and Fantasy section of my Netflix account:

Granted a movie staring talking balls of clay is pretty fantastic, but I don’t think I’d put it in the realm of “SciFi & Fantasy”. Then again, you’ve got Babe in there as well, so perhaps it is my perception of what SciFi & Fantasy is that is off ;-).

item.title: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband – doesn’t make any sense to me. This would be like taxing people extra who use the most long distance minutes, even though they already pay to use those minutes.
item.content:encoded: Consumer group wants to tax Netflix to pay for rural broadband – doesn’t make any sense to me. This would be like taxing people extra who use the most long distance minutes, even though they already pay to use those minutes.
